trans-unit.source: Best Practices for Performance Improvements Using Service Bus Brokered Messaging
trans-unit.target: Best Practices for Performance Improvements Using Service Bus Brokered Messaging

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to use <token>sb1</token> to optimize performance when exchanging brokered messages.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to use <token>sb1</token> to optimize performance when exchanging brokered messages.

trans-unit.source: The first part of this topic describes the different mechanisms that are offered to help increase performance.
trans-unit.target: The first part of this topic describes the different mechanisms that are offered to help increase performance.

trans-unit.source: The second part provides guidance on how to use <token>sb2</token> in a way that can offer the best performance in a given scenario.
trans-unit.target: The second part provides guidance on how to use <token>sb2</token> in a way that can offer the best performance in a given scenario.

trans-unit.source: Throughout this topic, the term “client” refers to any entity that accesses <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: Throughout this topic, the term “client” refers to any entity that accesses <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: A client can take the role of a sender or a receiver.
trans-unit.target: A client can take the role of a sender or a receiver.

trans-unit.source: The term “sender” is used for a <token>sb2</token> queue or topic client that sends messages to a <token>sb2</token> queue or topic.
trans-unit.target: The term “sender” is used for a <token>sb2</token> queue or topic client that sends messages to a <token>sb2</token> queue or topic.

trans-unit.source: The term “receiver” refers to a <token>sb2</token> queue or subscription client that receives messages from a <token>sb2</token> queue or subscription.
trans-unit.target: The term “receiver” refers to a <token>sb2</token> queue or subscription client that receives messages from a <token>sb2</token> queue or subscription.

trans-unit.source: Mechanisms
trans-unit.target: Mechanisms

trans-unit.source: This section introduces several concepts employed by <token>sb2</token> to help boost performance.
trans-unit.target: This section introduces several concepts employed by <token>sb2</token> to help boost performance.

trans-unit.source: Protocols
trans-unit.target: Protocols

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> enables clients to send and receive messages via two protocols: the <token>sb2</token> client protocol, and HTTP.
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> enables clients to send and receive messages via two protocols: the <token>sb2</token> client protocol, and HTTP.

trans-unit.source: The <token>sb2</token> client protocol is more efficient, because it maintains the connection to the <token>sb2</token> service as long as the message factory exists.
trans-unit.target: The <token>sb2</token> client protocol is more efficient, because it maintains the connection to the <token>sb2</token> service as long as the message factory exists.

trans-unit.source: It also implements batching and prefetching.
trans-unit.target: It also implements batching and prefetching.

trans-unit.source: The <token>sb2</token> client protocol is available for .NET applications using the .NET API.
trans-unit.target: The <token>sb2</token> client protocol is available for .NET applications using the .NET API.

trans-unit.source: Unless explicitly mentioned, all content in this topic assumes the use of the <token>sb2</token> client protocol.
trans-unit.target: Unless explicitly mentioned, all content in this topic assumes the use of the <token>sb2</token> client protocol.

trans-unit.source: Reusing factories and clients
trans-unit.target: Reusing factories and clients

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> client objects, such as <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueClient</codeEntityReference> or <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.MessageSender</codeEntityReference>, are created through a <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.MessagingFactory</codeEntityReference> object, which also provides internal management of connections.
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> client objects, such as <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueClient</codeEntityReference> or <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.MessageSender</codeEntityReference>, are created through a <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.MessagingFactory</codeEntityReference> object, which also provides internal management of connections.

trans-unit.source: You should not close messaging factories or queue, topic, and subscription clients after you send a message, and then re-create them when you send the next message.
trans-unit.target: You should not close messaging factories or queue, topic, and subscription clients after you send a message, and then re-create them when you send the next message.

trans-unit.source: Closing a messaging factory deletes the connection to the <token>sb2</token> service, and a new connection is established when recreating the factory.
trans-unit.target: Closing a messaging factory deletes the connection to the <token>sb2</token> service, and a new connection is established when recreating the factory.

trans-unit.source: Establishing a connection is an expensive operation that can be avoided by re-using the same factory and client objects for multiple operations.
trans-unit.target: Establishing a connection is an expensive operation that can be avoided by re-using the same factory and client objects for multiple operations.

trans-unit.source: Concurrent operations
trans-unit.target: Concurrent operations

trans-unit.source: Performing an operation (send, receive, delete, etc.)
trans-unit.target: Performing an operation (send, receive, delete, etc.)

trans-unit.source: takes some time.
trans-unit.target: takes some time.

trans-unit.source: This time includes the processing of the operation by the <token>sb2</token> service in addition to the latency of the request and the reply.
trans-unit.target: This time includes the processing of the operation by the <token>sb2</token> service in addition to the latency of the request and the reply.

trans-unit.source: To increase the number of operations per time, operations must execute concurrently.
trans-unit.target: To increase the number of operations per time, operations must execute concurrently.

trans-unit.source: You can do this in several different ways:
trans-unit.target: You can do this in several different ways:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Asynchronous operations</embeddedLabel>: the client pipelines operations by performing asynchronous operations.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Asynchronous operations</embeddedLabel>: the client pipelines operations by performing asynchronous operations.

trans-unit.source: The next request is started before the previous request is completed.
trans-unit.target: The next request is started before the previous request is completed.

trans-unit.source: The following is an example of an asynchronous <embeddedLabel>send</embeddedLabel> operation:
trans-unit.target: The following is an example of an asynchronous <embeddedLabel>send</embeddedLabel> operation:

trans-unit.source: This is an example of an asynchronous <embeddedLabel>receive</embeddedLabel> operation:
trans-unit.target: This is an example of an asynchronous <embeddedLabel>receive</embeddedLabel> operation:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Multiple factories</embeddedLabel>: all clients (senders in addition to receivers) that are created by the same factory share one TCP connection.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Multiple factories</embeddedLabel>: all clients (senders in addition to receivers) that are created by the same factory share one TCP connection.

trans-unit.source: The maximum message throughput is limited by the number of operations that can go through this TCP connection.
trans-unit.target: The maximum message throughput is limited by the number of operations that can go through this TCP connection.

trans-unit.source: The throughput that can be obtained with a single factory varies greatly with TCP round-trip times and message size.
trans-unit.target: The throughput that can be obtained with a single factory varies greatly with TCP round-trip times and message size.

trans-unit.source: To obtain higher throughput rates, you should use multiple messaging factories.
trans-unit.target: To obtain higher throughput rates, you should use multiple messaging factories.

trans-unit.source: Receive mode
trans-unit.target: Receive mode

trans-unit.source: When creating a queue or subscription client, you can specify a receive mode: <newTerm>Peek-lock</newTerm> or <newTerm>Receive and delete</newTerm>.
trans-unit.target: When creating a queue or subscription client, you can specify a receive mode: <newTerm>Peek-lock</newTerm> or <newTerm>Receive and delete</newTerm>.

trans-unit.source: The default receive mode is <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.ReceiveMode.PeekLock</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: The default receive mode is <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.ReceiveMode.PeekLock</codeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: When operating in this mode, the client sends a request to receive a message from <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: When operating in this mode, the client sends a request to receive a message from <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: After the client has received the message, it sends a request to complete the message.
trans-unit.target: After the client has received the message, it sends a request to complete the message.

trans-unit.source: When setting the receive mode to <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.ReceiveMode.ReceiveAndDelete</codeEntityReference>, both steps are combined in a single request.
trans-unit.target: When setting the receive mode to <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.ReceiveMode.ReceiveAndDelete</codeEntityReference>, both steps are combined in a single request.

trans-unit.source: This reduces the overall number of operations, and can improve the overall message throughput.
trans-unit.target: This reduces the overall number of operations, and can improve the overall message throughput.

trans-unit.source: This performance gain comes at the risk of losing messages.
trans-unit.target: This performance gain comes at the risk of losing messages.

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> does not support transactions for receive-and-delete operations.
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> does not support transactions for receive-and-delete operations.

trans-unit.source: In addition, peek-lock semantics are required for any scenarios in which the client wants to defer or deadletter a message.
trans-unit.target: In addition, peek-lock semantics are required for any scenarios in which the client wants to defer or deadletter a message.

trans-unit.source: Client-side batching
trans-unit.target: Client-side batching

trans-unit.source: Client-side batching enables a queue or topic client to delay the sending of a message for a certain period of time.
trans-unit.target: Client-side batching enables a queue or topic client to delay the sending of a message for a certain period of time.

trans-unit.source: If the client sends additional messages during this time period, it transmits the messages in a single batch.
trans-unit.target: If the client sends additional messages during this time period, it transmits the messages in a single batch.

trans-unit.source: Client-side batching also causes a queue/subscription client to batch multiple <embeddedLabel>Complete</embeddedLabel> requests into a single request.
trans-unit.target: Client-side batching also causes a queue/subscription client to batch multiple <embeddedLabel>Complete</embeddedLabel> requests into a single request.

trans-unit.source: Batching is only available for asynchronous <embeddedLabel>Send</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Complete</embeddedLabel> operations.
trans-unit.target: Batching is only available for asynchronous <embeddedLabel>Send</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Complete</embeddedLabel> operations.

trans-unit.source: Synchronous operations are immediately sent to the <token>sb2</token> service.
trans-unit.target: Synchronous operations are immediately sent to the <token>sb2</token> service.

trans-unit.source: Batching does not occur for peek or receive operations, nor does batching occur across clients.
trans-unit.target: Batching does not occur for peek or receive operations, nor does batching occur across clients.

trans-unit.source: If the batch exceeds the maximum message size, the last message is removed from the batch, and the client immediately sends the batch.
trans-unit.target: If the batch exceeds the maximum message size, the last message is removed from the batch, and the client immediately sends the batch.

trans-unit.source: The last message becomes the first message of the next batch.
trans-unit.target: The last message becomes the first message of the next batch.

trans-unit.source: By default, a client uses a batch interval of 20ms.
trans-unit.target: By default, a client uses a batch interval of 20ms.

trans-unit.source: You can change the batch interval by setting the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.NetMessagingTransportSettings.BatchFlushInterval</codeEntityReference> property before creating the messaging factory.
trans-unit.target: You can change the batch interval by setting the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.NetMessagingTransportSettings.BatchFlushInterval</codeEntityReference> property before creating the messaging factory.

trans-unit.source: This setting affects all clients that are created by this factory.
trans-unit.target: This setting affects all clients that are created by this factory.

trans-unit.source: To disable batching, set the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.NetMessagingTransportSettings.BatchFlushInterval</codeEntityReference> property to <languageKeyword>TimeSpan.Zero</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: To disable batching, set the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.NetMessagingTransportSettings.BatchFlushInterval</codeEntityReference> property to <languageKeyword>TimeSpan.Zero</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Batching does not affect the number of billable messaging operations, and is available only for the <token>sb2</token> client protocol.
trans-unit.target: Batching does not affect the number of billable messaging operations, and is available only for the <token>sb2</token> client protocol.

trans-unit.source: The HTTP protocol does not support batching.
trans-unit.target: The HTTP protocol does not support batching.

trans-unit.source: Batching store access
trans-unit.target: Batching store access

trans-unit.source: To increase the throughput of a queue/topic/subscription, the <token>sb2</token> service batches multiple messages when it writes to its internal store.
trans-unit.target: To increase the throughput of a queue/topic/subscription, the <token>sb2</token> service batches multiple messages when it writes to its internal store.

trans-unit.source: If enabled on a queue or topic, writing messages into the store will be batched.
trans-unit.target: If enabled on a queue or topic, writing messages into the store will be batched.

trans-unit.source: If enabled on a queue or subscription, deleting messages from the store will be batched.
trans-unit.target: If enabled on a queue or subscription, deleting messages from the store will be batched.

trans-unit.source: If batched store access is enabled for an entity, <token>sb2</token> delays a store write operation regarding that entity by up to 20ms.
trans-unit.target: If batched store access is enabled for an entity, <token>sb2</token> delays a store write operation regarding that entity by up to 20ms.

trans-unit.source: Additional store operations that occur during this interval are added to the batch.
trans-unit.target: Additional store operations that occur during this interval are added to the batch.

trans-unit.source: Batched store access only affects <embeddedLabel>Send</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Complete</embeddedLabel> operations; receive operations are not affected.
trans-unit.target: Batched store access only affects <embeddedLabel>Send</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Complete</embeddedLabel> operations; receive operations are not affected.

trans-unit.source: Batched store access is a property on an entity.
trans-unit.target: Batched store access is a property on an entity.

trans-unit.source: Batching occurs across all entities that enable batched store access.
trans-unit.target: Batching occurs across all entities that enable batched store access.

trans-unit.source: When creating a new queue, topic or subscription, batched store access is enabled by default.
trans-unit.target: When creating a new queue, topic or subscription, batched store access is enabled by default.

trans-unit.source: To disable batched store access, set the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueDescription.EnableBatchedOperations</codeEntityReference> property to <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword> before creating the entity.
trans-unit.target: To disable batched store access, set the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueDescription.EnableBatchedOperations</codeEntityReference> property to <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword> before creating the entity.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Batched store access does not affect the number of billable messaging operations, and is a property of a queue, topic, or subscription.
trans-unit.target: Batched store access does not affect the number of billable messaging operations, and is a property of a queue, topic, or subscription.

trans-unit.source: It is independent of the receive mode and the protocol that is used between a client and the <token>sb2</token> service.
trans-unit.target: It is independent of the receive mode and the protocol that is used between a client and the <token>sb2</token> service.

trans-unit.source: Prefetching
trans-unit.target: Prefetching

trans-unit.source: Prefetching enables the queue or subscription client to load additional messages from the service when it performs a receive operation.
trans-unit.target: Prefetching enables the queue or subscription client to load additional messages from the service when it performs a receive operation.

trans-unit.source: The client stores these messages in a local cache.
trans-unit.target: The client stores these messages in a local cache.

trans-unit.source: The size of the cache is determined by the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueClient.PrefetchCount</codeEntityReference> and <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SubscriptionClient.PrefetchCount</codeEntityReference> properties.
trans-unit.target: The size of the cache is determined by the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueClient.PrefetchCount</codeEntityReference> and <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SubscriptionClient.PrefetchCount</codeEntityReference> properties.

trans-unit.source: Each client that enables prefetching maintains its own cache.
trans-unit.target: Each client that enables prefetching maintains its own cache.

trans-unit.source: A cache is not shared across clients.
trans-unit.target: A cache is not shared across clients.

trans-unit.source: If the client initiates a receive operation and its cache is empty, the service transmits a batch of messages.
trans-unit.target: If the client initiates a receive operation and its cache is empty, the service transmits a batch of messages.

trans-unit.source: The size of the batch equals the size of the cache or 256KB, whichever is smaller.
trans-unit.target: The size of the batch equals the size of the cache or 256KB, whichever is smaller.

trans-unit.source: If the client initiates a receive operation and the cache contains a message, the message is taken from the cache.
trans-unit.target: If the client initiates a receive operation and the cache contains a message, the message is taken from the cache.

trans-unit.source: When a message is prefetched, the service locks the prefetched message.
trans-unit.target: When a message is prefetched, the service locks the prefetched message.

trans-unit.source: By doing this, the prefetched message cannot be received by a different receiver.
trans-unit.target: By doing this, the prefetched message cannot be received by a different receiver.

trans-unit.source: If the receiver cannot complete the message before the lock expires, the message becomes available to other receivers.
trans-unit.target: If the receiver cannot complete the message before the lock expires, the message becomes available to other receivers.

trans-unit.source: The prefetched copy of the message remains in the cache.
trans-unit.target: The prefetched copy of the message remains in the cache.

trans-unit.source: The receiver that consumes the expired cached copy will receive an exception when it tries to complete that message.
trans-unit.target: The receiver that consumes the expired cached copy will receive an exception when it tries to complete that message.

trans-unit.source: By default, the message lock expires after 60 seconds.
trans-unit.target: By default, the message lock expires after 60 seconds.

trans-unit.source: This value can be extended to 5 minutes.
trans-unit.target: This value can be extended to 5 minutes.

trans-unit.source: To prevent the consumption of expired messages, the cache size should always be smaller than the number of messages that can be consumed by a client within the lock time-out interval.
trans-unit.target: To prevent the consumption of expired messages, the cache size should always be smaller than the number of messages that can be consumed by a client within the lock time-out interval.

trans-unit.source: When using the default lock expiration of 60 seconds, a good value for <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SubscriptionClient.PrefetchCount</codeEntityReference> is 20 times the maximum processing rates of all receivers of the factory.
trans-unit.target: When using the default lock expiration of 60 seconds, a good value for <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SubscriptionClient.PrefetchCount</codeEntityReference> is 20 times the maximum processing rates of all receivers of the factory.

trans-unit.source: For example, a factory creates 3 receivers, and each receiver can process up to 10 messages per second.
trans-unit.target: For example, a factory creates 3 receivers, and each receiver can process up to 10 messages per second.

trans-unit.source: The prefetch count should not exceed 20*3*10 = 600.
trans-unit.target: The prefetch count should not exceed 20*3*10 = 600.

trans-unit.source: By default, <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueClient.PrefetchCount</codeEntityReference> is set to 0, which means that no additional messages are fetched from the service.
trans-unit.target: By default, <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueClient.PrefetchCount</codeEntityReference> is set to 0, which means that no additional messages are fetched from the service.

trans-unit.source: Prefetching messages increases the overall throughput for a queue or subscription because it reduces the overall number of message operations, or round trips.
trans-unit.target: Prefetching messages increases the overall throughput for a queue or subscription because it reduces the overall number of message operations, or round trips.

trans-unit.source: Fetching the first message, however, will take longer (due to the increased message size).
trans-unit.target: Fetching the first message, however, will take longer (due to the increased message size).

trans-unit.source: Receiving prefetched messages will be faster because these messages have already been downloaded by the client.
trans-unit.target: Receiving prefetched messages will be faster because these messages have already been downloaded by the client.

trans-unit.source: The time-to-live (TTL) property of a message is checked by the server at the time the server sends the message to the client.
trans-unit.target: The time-to-live (TTL) property of a message is checked by the server at the time the server sends the message to the client.

trans-unit.source: The client does not check the message’s TTL property when the message is received.
trans-unit.target: The client does not check the message’s TTL property when the message is received.

trans-unit.source: Instead, the message can be received even if the message’s TTL has passed while the message was cached by the client.
trans-unit.target: Instead, the message can be received even if the message’s TTL has passed while the message was cached by the client.

trans-unit.source: Prefetching does not affect the number of billable messaging operations, and is available only for the <token>sb2</token> client protocol.
trans-unit.target: Prefetching does not affect the number of billable messaging operations, and is available only for the <token>sb2</token> client protocol.

trans-unit.source: The HTTP protocol does not support prefetching.
trans-unit.target: The HTTP protocol does not support prefetching.

trans-unit.source: Prefetching is available for both synchronous and asynchronous receive operations.
trans-unit.target: Prefetching is available for both synchronous and asynchronous receive operations.

trans-unit.source: Use of express queues or topics
trans-unit.target: Use of express queues or topics

trans-unit.source: Express entities enable high throughput and reduced latency scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Express entities enable high throughput and reduced latency scenarios.

trans-unit.source: With express entities, if a message is sent to a queue or topic is, it is not immediately stored in the messaging store.
trans-unit.target: With express entities, if a message is sent to a queue or topic is, it is not immediately stored in the messaging store.

trans-unit.source: Instead, the message is cached in memory.
trans-unit.target: Instead, the message is cached in memory.

trans-unit.source: If a message remains in the queue for more than a few seconds, it is automatically written to stable storage, thus protecting it against loss due to an outage.
trans-unit.target: If a message remains in the queue for more than a few seconds, it is automatically written to stable storage, thus protecting it against loss due to an outage.

trans-unit.source: Writing the message into a memory cache increases throughput and reduces latency because there is no access to stable storage at the time the message is sent.
trans-unit.target: Writing the message into a memory cache increases throughput and reduces latency because there is no access to stable storage at the time the message is sent.

trans-unit.source: Messages that are consumed within a few seconds are not written to the messaging store.
trans-unit.target: Messages that are consumed within a few seconds are not written to the messaging store.

trans-unit.source: The following example creates an express topic:
trans-unit.target: The following example creates an express topic:

trans-unit.source: If a message containing critical information that must not be lost is sent to an express entity, the sender can force <token>sb2</token> to immediately persist the message to stable storage by setting the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.ForcePersistence</codeEntityReference> property to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: If a message containing critical information that must not be lost is sent to an express entity, the sender can force <token>sb2</token> to immediately persist the message to stable storage by setting the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.ForcePersistence</codeEntityReference> property to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="4d1ad081-82ea-47bc-ae4e-38d41f22a0db" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">What's New in the Azure SDK 2.3 Release (April 2014)</link>.
trans-unit.target: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="4d1ad081-82ea-47bc-ae4e-38d41f22a0db" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">What's New in the Azure SDK 2.3 Release (April 2014)</link>.

trans-unit.source: Use of partitioned queues or topics
trans-unit.target: Use of partitioned queues or topics

trans-unit.source: Internally, <token>sb2</token> uses the same node and messaging store to process and store all messages for a messaging entity (queue or topic).
trans-unit.target: Internally, <token>sb2</token> uses the same node and messaging store to process and store all messages for a messaging entity (queue or topic).

trans-unit.source: A partitioned queue or topic, on the other hand, is distributed across multiple nodes and messaging stores.
trans-unit.target: A partitioned queue or topic, on the other hand, is distributed across multiple nodes and messaging stores.

trans-unit.source: Partitioned queues and topics not only yield a higher throughput than regular queues and topics, they also exhibit superior availability.
trans-unit.target: Partitioned queues and topics not only yield a higher throughput than regular queues and topics, they also exhibit superior availability.

trans-unit.source: To create a partitioned entity, set the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueDescription.EnablePartitioning</codeEntityReference> property to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>, as shown in the following example.
trans-unit.target: To create a partitioned entity, set the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueDescription.EnablePartitioning</codeEntityReference> property to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>, as shown in the following example.

trans-unit.source: <token>crabout</token> partitioned entities, see <link xlink:href="cfbb5d64-b54e-4420-9971-436d8d820583" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Partitioning Messaging Entities</link>.
trans-unit.target: <token>crabout</token> partitioned entities, see <link xlink:href="cfbb5d64-b54e-4420-9971-436d8d820583" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Partitioning Messaging Entities</link>.

trans-unit.source: Use of multiple queues
trans-unit.target: Use of multiple queues

trans-unit.source: If it is not possible to use a partitioned queue or topic, or the expected load cannot be handled by a single partitioned queue or topic, you must use multiple messaging entities.
trans-unit.target: If it is not possible to use a partitioned queue or topic, or the expected load cannot be handled by a single partitioned queue or topic, you must use multiple messaging entities.

trans-unit.source: When using multiple entities, create a dedicated client for each entity, instead of using the same client for all entities.
trans-unit.target: When using multiple entities, create a dedicated client for each entity, instead of using the same client for all entities.

trans-unit.source: Scenarios
trans-unit.target: Scenarios

trans-unit.source: The following sections describe typical messaging scenarios and outline the preferred <token>sb2</token> settings.
trans-unit.target: The following sections describe typical messaging scenarios and outline the preferred <token>sb2</token> settings.

trans-unit.source: Throughput rates are classified as small (<1msg/s), moderate (≥1msg/s, <100msg/s) and high (≥100msg/s).
trans-unit.target: Throughput rates are classified as small (<1msg/s), moderate (≥1msg/s, <100msg/s) and high (≥100msg/s).

trans-unit.source: The number of clients are classified as small (≤5), moderate (>5, ≤20), and large (>20).
trans-unit.target: The number of clients are classified as small (≤5), moderate (>5, ≤20), and large (>20).

trans-unit.source: High-throughput queue
trans-unit.target: High-throughput queue

trans-unit.source: Goal: Maximize throughput of a single queue.
trans-unit.target: Goal: Maximize throughput of a single queue.

trans-unit.source: The number of senders and receivers is small.
trans-unit.target: The number of senders and receivers is small.

trans-unit.source: Use a partitioned queue for improved performance and availability.
trans-unit.target: Use a partitioned queue for improved performance and availability.

trans-unit.source: To increase the overall send rate into the queue, use multiple message factories to create senders.
trans-unit.target: To increase the overall send rate into the queue, use multiple message factories to create senders.

trans-unit.source: For each sender, use asynchronous operations or multiple threads.
trans-unit.target: For each sender, use asynchronous operations or multiple threads.

trans-unit.source: To increase the overall receive rate from the queue, use multiple message factories to create receivers.
trans-unit.target: To increase the overall receive rate from the queue, use multiple message factories to create receivers.

trans-unit.source: Use asynchronous operations to take advantage of client-side batching.
trans-unit.target: Use asynchronous operations to take advantage of client-side batching.

trans-unit.source: Set the batching interval to 50ms to reduce the number of <token>sb2</token> client protocol transmissions.
trans-unit.target: Set the batching interval to 50ms to reduce the number of <token>sb2</token> client protocol transmissions.

trans-unit.source: If multiple senders are used, increase the batching interval to 100ms.
trans-unit.target: If multiple senders are used, increase the batching interval to 100ms.

trans-unit.source: Leave batched store access enabled.
trans-unit.target: Leave batched store access enabled.

trans-unit.source: This increases the overall rate at which messages can be written into the queue.
trans-unit.target: This increases the overall rate at which messages can be written into the queue.

trans-unit.source: Set the prefetch count to 20 times the maximum processing rates of all receivers of a factory.
trans-unit.target: Set the prefetch count to 20 times the maximum processing rates of all receivers of a factory.

trans-unit.source: This reduces the number of <token>sb2</token> client protocol transmissions.
trans-unit.target: This reduces the number of <token>sb2</token> client protocol transmissions.

trans-unit.source: Multiple high-throughput queues
trans-unit.target: Multiple high-throughput queues

trans-unit.source: Goal: Maximize overall throughput of multiple queues.
trans-unit.target: Goal: Maximize overall throughput of multiple queues.

trans-unit.source: The throughput of an individual queue is moderate or high.
trans-unit.target: The throughput of an individual queue is moderate or high.

trans-unit.source: To obtain maximum throughput across multiple queues, use the settings outlined to maximize the throughput of a single queue.
trans-unit.target: To obtain maximum throughput across multiple queues, use the settings outlined to maximize the throughput of a single queue.

trans-unit.source: In addition, use different factories to create clients that send or receive from different queues.
trans-unit.target: In addition, use different factories to create clients that send or receive from different queues.

trans-unit.source: Low latency queue
trans-unit.target: Low latency queue

trans-unit.source: Goal: Minimize end-to-end latency of a queue or topic.
trans-unit.target: Goal: Minimize end-to-end latency of a queue or topic.

trans-unit.source: The number of senders and receivers is small.
trans-unit.target: The number of senders and receivers is small.

trans-unit.source: The throughput of the queue is small or moderate.
trans-unit.target: The throughput of the queue is small or moderate.

trans-unit.source: Use a partitioned queue for improved availability.
trans-unit.target: Use a partitioned queue for improved availability.

trans-unit.source: Disable client-side batching.
trans-unit.target: Disable client-side batching.

trans-unit.source: The client immediately sends a message.
trans-unit.target: The client immediately sends a message.

trans-unit.source: Disable batched store access.
trans-unit.target: Disable batched store access.

trans-unit.source: The service immediately writes the message to the store.
trans-unit.target: The service immediately writes the message to the store.

trans-unit.source: If using a single client, set the prefetch count to 20 times the processing rate of the receiver.
trans-unit.target: If using a single client, set the prefetch count to 20 times the processing rate of the receiver.

trans-unit.source: If multiple messages arrive at the queue at the same time, the <token>sb2</token> client protocol transmits them all at the same time.
trans-unit.target: If multiple messages arrive at the queue at the same time, the <token>sb2</token> client protocol transmits them all at the same time.

trans-unit.source: When the client receives the next message, that message is already in the local cache.
trans-unit.target: When the client receives the next message, that message is already in the local cache.

trans-unit.source: The cache should be small.
trans-unit.target: The cache should be small.

trans-unit.source: If using multiple clients, set the prefetch count to 0.
trans-unit.target: If using multiple clients, set the prefetch count to 0.

trans-unit.source: By doing this, the second client can receive the second message while the first client is still processing the first message.
trans-unit.target: By doing this, the second client can receive the second message while the first client is still processing the first message.

trans-unit.source: Queue with a large number of senders
trans-unit.target: Queue with a large number of senders

trans-unit.source: Goal: Maximize throughput of a queue or topic with a large number of senders.
trans-unit.target: Goal: Maximize throughput of a queue or topic with a large number of senders.

trans-unit.source: Each sender sends messages with a moderate rate.
trans-unit.target: Each sender sends messages with a moderate rate.

trans-unit.source: The number of receivers is small.
trans-unit.target: The number of receivers is small.

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> enables up to 1000 concurrent connections to a messaging entity (or 5000 using AMQP).
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> enables up to 1000 concurrent connections to a messaging entity (or 5000 using AMQP).

trans-unit.source: This limit is enforced at the namespace level, and queues/topics/subscriptions are capped by the limit of concurrent connections per namespace.
trans-unit.target: This limit is enforced at the namespace level, and queues/topics/subscriptions are capped by the limit of concurrent connections per namespace.

trans-unit.source: For queues, this number is shared between senders and receivers.
trans-unit.target: For queues, this number is shared between senders and receivers.

trans-unit.source: If all 1000 connections are required for senders, you should replace the queue with a topic and a single subscription.
trans-unit.target: If all 1000 connections are required for senders, you should replace the queue with a topic and a single subscription.

trans-unit.source: A topic accepts up to 1000 concurrent connections from senders, whereas the subscription accepts an additional 1000 concurrent connections from receivers.
trans-unit.target: A topic accepts up to 1000 concurrent connections from senders, whereas the subscription accepts an additional 1000 concurrent connections from receivers.

trans-unit.source: If more than 1000 concurrent senders are required, the senders should send messages to the <token>sb2</token> protocol via HTTP.
trans-unit.target: If more than 1000 concurrent senders are required, the senders should send messages to the <token>sb2</token> protocol via HTTP.

trans-unit.source: To maximize throughput, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To maximize throughput, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Use a partitioned queue for improved performance and availability.
trans-unit.target: Use a partitioned queue for improved performance and availability.

trans-unit.source: If each sender resides in a different process, use only a single factory per process.
trans-unit.target: If each sender resides in a different process, use only a single factory per process.

trans-unit.source: Use asynchronous operations to take advantage of client-side batching.
trans-unit.target: Use asynchronous operations to take advantage of client-side batching.

trans-unit.source: Use the default batching interval of 20ms to reduce the number of <token>sb2</token> client protocol transmissions.
trans-unit.target: Use the default batching interval of 20ms to reduce the number of <token>sb2</token> client protocol transmissions.

trans-unit.source: Leave batched store access enabled.
trans-unit.target: Leave batched store access enabled.

trans-unit.source: This increases the overall rate at which messages can be written into the queue or topic.
trans-unit.target: This increases the overall rate at which messages can be written into the queue or topic.

trans-unit.source: Set the prefetch count to 20 times the maximum processing rates of all receivers of a factory.
trans-unit.target: Set the prefetch count to 20 times the maximum processing rates of all receivers of a factory.

trans-unit.source: This reduces the number of <token>sb2</token> client protocol transmissions.
trans-unit.target: This reduces the number of <token>sb2</token> client protocol transmissions.

trans-unit.source: Queue with a large number of receivers
trans-unit.target: Queue with a large number of receivers

trans-unit.source: Goal: Maximize the receive rate of a queue or subscription with a large number of receivers.
trans-unit.target: Goal: Maximize the receive rate of a queue or subscription with a large number of receivers.

trans-unit.source: Each receiver receives messages at a moderate rate.
trans-unit.target: Each receiver receives messages at a moderate rate.

trans-unit.source: The number of senders is small.
trans-unit.target: The number of senders is small.

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> enables up to 1000 concurrent connections to an entity.
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> enables up to 1000 concurrent connections to an entity.

trans-unit.source: If a queue requires more than 1000 receivers, you should replace the queue with a topic and multiple subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: If a queue requires more than 1000 receivers, you should replace the queue with a topic and multiple subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: Each subscription can support up to 1000 concurrent connections.
trans-unit.target: Each subscription can support up to 1000 concurrent connections.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, receivers can access the queue via the HTTP protocol.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, receivers can access the queue via the HTTP protocol.

trans-unit.source: To maximize throughput, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To maximize throughput, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Use a partitioned queue for improved performance and availability.
trans-unit.target: Use a partitioned queue for improved performance and availability.

trans-unit.source: If each receiver resides in a different process, use only a single factory per process.
trans-unit.target: If each receiver resides in a different process, use only a single factory per process.

trans-unit.source: Receivers can use synchronous or asynchronous operations.
trans-unit.target: Receivers can use synchronous or asynchronous operations.

trans-unit.source: Given the moderate receive rate of an individual receiver, client-side batching of a <languageKeyword>Complete</languageKeyword> request does not affect receiver throughput.
trans-unit.target: Given the moderate receive rate of an individual receiver, client-side batching of a <languageKeyword>Complete</languageKeyword> request does not affect receiver throughput.

trans-unit.source: Leave batched store access enabled.
trans-unit.target: Leave batched store access enabled.

trans-unit.source: This reduces the overall load of the entity.
trans-unit.target: This reduces the overall load of the entity.

trans-unit.source: It also reduces the overall rate at which messages can be written into the queue or topic.
trans-unit.target: It also reduces the overall rate at which messages can be written into the queue or topic.

trans-unit.source: Set the prefetch count to a small value (for example, <languageKeyword>PrefetchCount</languageKeyword> = 10).
trans-unit.target: Set the prefetch count to a small value (for example, <languageKeyword>PrefetchCount</languageKeyword> = 10).

trans-unit.source: This prevents receivers from being idle while other receivers have large numbers of messages cached.
trans-unit.target: This prevents receivers from being idle while other receivers have large numbers of messages cached.

trans-unit.source: Topic with a small number of subscriptions
trans-unit.target: Topic with a small number of subscriptions

trans-unit.source: Goal: Maximize the throughput of a topic with a small number of subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: Goal: Maximize the throughput of a topic with a small number of subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: A message is received by many subscriptions, which means the combined receive rate over all subscriptions is larger than the send rate.
trans-unit.target: A message is received by many subscriptions, which means the combined receive rate over all subscriptions is larger than the send rate.

trans-unit.source: The number of senders is small.
trans-unit.target: The number of senders is small.

trans-unit.source: The number of receivers per subscription is small.
trans-unit.target: The number of receivers per subscription is small.

trans-unit.source: Set the prefetch count to 20 times the maximum processing rates of all receivers of a factory.

trans-unit.source: This reduces the number of <token>sb2</token> client protocol transmissions.

trans-unit.source: Goal: Maximize the throughput of a topic with a large number of subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: Goal: Maximize the throughput of a topic with a large number of subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: A message is received by many subscriptions, which means the combined receive rate over all subscriptions is much larger than the send rate.
trans-unit.target: A message is received by many subscriptions, which means the combined receive rate over all subscriptions is much larger than the send rate.

trans-unit.source: The number of senders is small.

trans-unit.target: The number of receivers per subscription is small.

trans-unit.source: It is assumed that the number of senders and number of receivers per subscription is small.
